author: raghushantha

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body:
To support this, we'll need to create our own [`debian/copyright`](https://www.debian.org/doc/packaging-manuals/copyright-format/1.0) file and include in during package generation with the `--deb-meta-file` argument to FPM.

There are likely other files and settings we need to configure for every package manager before we release packages into upstream repositories (and we may even want to move away from FPM and instead script every build ourselves).

Note that this is **not** a problem for going public; we include our license files in the base directory; this is more a matter of presentation.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: As this is a packaging aesthetic and not a requirement, moving assignment to @raghushantha.

comments.author: JamesWTruher
comments.body:
the use of the --deb-meta-file doesn't put the copyright file in the correct place, and putting a copyright file in the right place still doesn't get the information to show up correctly. We should be the copyright file in the right place, but getting it to show up in the app doesn't really need to be done for release.

Also, there is an FPM issue on this: https://github.com/jordansissel/fpm/issues/1116

title: Ubuntu software center does not show License information for PowerShell package
